intro: Schizoglossum bidens subsp. bidens, commonly known as the common schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Campanulaceae family.
